p: Although decreasing high‐flow events in the higher‐order reaches will decrease species downstream drift (Death, 2008), it might affect species through higher temperatures (Pyne & Poff, 2017) and lower oxygen content (Allan & Castillo, 2007). This ecological effect can also be well described by species increased abundances in response to significant decrease in low‐flow conditions (fl1 in Kinzig, Figures 4g and 6l,q). These increasing trends show the vulnerability of species to, for example, prolonged low‐flow conditions, which have been most often explored in recent years (Leigh, 2013; Leigh & Datry, 2016; Walters, 2016).
